title: MedQuiz Pro - Comprehensive Accessibility Audit Report

issues.message: No nav elements found for navigation sections
Missing skip link as first focusable element
Medical abbreviation "USMLE" should be marked up with <abbr> tag and full explanation
issues.medicalEducationImpact: High - Critical for medical students with learning disabilities

issues.message: Missing skip link as first focusable element
Page should start with h1 element
Medical abbreviation "USMLE" should be marked up with <abbr> tag and full explanation
issues.medicalEducationImpact: High - Critical for medical students with learning disabilities

medicalEducationSpecific.recommendation: Implement proper ARIA radiogroup structure for multiple choice questions
medicalEducationSpecific.impact: Critical for screen reader users taking medical exams

medicalEducationSpecific.recommendation: Add <abbr> tags for medical abbreviations with full explanations
medicalEducationSpecific.impact: Helps students with learning disabilities understand terminology

medicalEducationSpecific.recommendation: Ensure exam timers are announced to assistive technology
Provide detailed alternative text for medical diagrams and charts
medicalEducationSpecific.impact: Essential for visually impaired medical students

recommendations.title: Implement Skip Navigation
recommendations.description: Add skip links to help keyboard users bypass repetitive navigation
recommendations.implementation: Add hidden skip link as first focusable element

recommendations.title: Improve Color Contrast
recommendations.description: Ensure all text meets WCAG AA contrast requirements
recommendations.implementation: Review color palette and adjust contrast ratios

recommendations.title: Enhance Focus Indicators
recommendations.description: Provide visible focus indicators for all interactive elements
recommendations.implementation: Add CSS outline or box-shadow for focus states

recommendations.title: Screen Reader Optimization
recommendations.description: Add proper ARIA labels and descriptions

nextSteps: Fix all critical and high severity issues
Conduct user testing with assistive technology
